text:
My team is in the process of establishing a development workflow. We plan to use Sandbox sites for feature development and QA and then we'll deploy to the live site.

When setting up a new sandbox site, it's there a preferred method for importing content (pages, blog posts, etc.) from the live site? I don't see any native tools for syncing between CMS sites w/in HubSpot.
<@U025VPJHG9Z> I use "content staging" in the production site to actually check content before going live. I use the sandbox for general template testing and setup only.
I'd be interested to know if others do it differently
There are import option for Pages and Blog Posts but they seem very limited.

Reminder: Are you a developer new to HubSpot, looking to get started building on CMS Hub? Check out our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started|quick start guide> to get a quick taste. When you’re ready to learn more head on over to our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides|tutorials and guides> to learn by doing. When you’ve got a chance, we recommend looping back and reading the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/key-concepts|Key Concepts> of the CMS. It explains how all of the pieces of the CMS fit together. Welcome to HubSpot development, there’s never been a better time to be HubSpot developer!
Hello everyone, i am George and i am here to learn and share knowledge about HubSpot. I have knowledge of HTML CSS JS JQUERY and REACT JS. Thank you :slightly_smiling_face:
